comments.body: Installing `1.4.30` throws the following error: `node_modules/@types/chokidar/index.d.ts(21,38): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'Event'.`. Downgrading to `1.4.29` fixes this issue.
`Event` is defined in `lib.d.ts`. What is your `tsconfig.json`?

I looked at your `tsconfig.json` and it looks like you can solve this by adding `"dom"` to your `"lib"`.
This of course leaves the question of why a node-only library uses a dom-only type. @KnisterPeter, Are these really DOM events?
Hm I do not think that is intended behavior. Probably other node libraries are also affected as they neither depend on the DOM

@andy-ms Looking at https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar/blob/master/lib/nodefs-handler.js#L26 it seems the raw event from node fs is used. According to https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/node/node-4.d.ts#L1661 that seems to be a regular `event: string`.

Since this issue is blocking us from progressing on with typed chokidar, could you remove the `Event` from this file? Thank you in advance!
